question: Which of the following is NOT an example of capillary action?
option1: Rise of ink in the fine pores of blotting paper
option2: soaking of water by a towel
option3: Wood swells in rainy season due to rise of moisture
explanation: Examples of capillarity : (i) Ink rises in the fine pores of blotting paper leaving the paper dry. (ii) A towel soaks water. (iii) Oil rises in the long narrow spaces between the threads of a wick. (iv) Wood swells in rainy season due to rise of moisture from air in the pores.
